thread.title: Chicago PD questioning suspects in live-streamed torture vid, unsure if ‘f**k white people’ points to hate crime
thread.title_full: Chicago PD questioning suspects in live-streamed torture vid, unsure if ‘f**k white people’ points to hate crime

author: Brett T.
title: Chicago PD questioning suspects in live-streamed torture vid, unsure if ‘f**k white people’ points to hate crime
text:
Chicago PD questioning suspects in live-streamed torture vid, unsure if ‘f**k white people’ points to hate crime Posted at 8:01 pm on January 4, 2017 by Brett T. Share on Facebook Share on Twitter 
Editor’s note: This post contains graphic content. 
A video so disturbing that people were hoping it was a hoax appears to real, and Chicago police say they are currently questioning suspects in the torture and beating of a man to shouts of “f**k white people” and “f**k Donald Trump” that was live-streamed on the Internet. Regarding the disturbing video that surfaced on social media of a battery: Incident is under investigation/suspects are being questioned pic.twitter.com/GGi3qs9rGv 
— Chicago Police (@Chicago_Police) January 4, 2017 “F–k Donald Trump, f–k white people”: Four people in custody after man tortured in Facebook live video https://t.co/lFeWtaOZDT 
— Jon Passantino (@passantino) January 5, 2017 Chicago police call the Facebook Live video attack "a brutal attack on an adult male with special needs" pic.twitter.com/JALyjZ9h36 
— BuzzFeed News (@BuzzFeedNews) January 5, 2017 
Here’s the video: please be aware that it’s graphic and very disturbing. #BREAKING : Chicago Police tell FOX 32 that four people are in custody after man tied up, tortured on Facebook Live https://t.co/TY2rboK0JE pic.twitter.com/m0z6yRRtUI 
— FOX 32 News (@fox32news) January 4, 2017 
Police held a press conference Wednesday afternoon. Four in custody after Facebook Live video shows a man being tortured in Chicago. "Fuck Donald Trump" can be heard https://t.co/YufKl5qZs6 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 CPD speaking now: "The victim, who is not a Chicago resident, is currently recovering" pic.twitter.com/HH2x73f5Qt 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 Police say officers found the man, a suburban resident reported missing, yesterday. He may have been kidnapped. Video streamed online. 
— Mitch Smith (@MitchKSmith) January 5, 2017 4 people in custody. 3 from Chicago, 1 from Carpentersville, charges expected in the next 24 hours 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 Chicago police: -Suspected attackers stole van, took the victim from suburb 
-4 people in custody. Charges expected in 24 hours pic.twitter.com/mPkQzhzURN 
— BuzzFeed News (@BuzzFeedNews) January 5, 2017 Is this a hate crime? CPD won't say at this point – still under investigation. “If the facts got us in that direction” then they’ll pursue 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 Victim was released from hospital. Chicago police say hate crime charges are possible. "It's sickening," police superintendent says. 
— Mitch Smith (@MitchKSmith) January 5, 2017 Chicago Police superintendent: "It's sickening. It makes you wonder what would make individuals treat somebody like that" 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 CPD is investigating if the “fuck white people/ Fuck Donald Trump” lines were “sincere or stupid ranting or raving" pic.twitter.com/o0GbviLbBI 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 The victim is white. Anti-white and anti-Trump messages are heard in video of beating. Police say the four suspects are African-American. 
— Mitch Smith (@MitchKSmith) January 5, 2017 Chicago Police say the victim appears to have initially went voluntarily with one of the perpetrators he knew from school 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 CPD: "At this point we don't have anything concrete to really point us" towards a hate crime, again calls it “stupidity” 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 Chicago PD don't have anything concrete to call attack a hate crime. Repeatedly emphasize its sickening stupidity https://t.co/QP2hnL6e8R 
— BuzzFeed News (@BuzzFeedNews) January 5, 2017 Someone asks if this was politically motivated; Chicago Police Superintendent Johnson just says “no.” 
— Brandon Wall (@Walldo) January 5, 2017 CPD press conference regarding disturbing live social media video depicting a battery ; victim was tied up https://t.co/jDrjfz4sJV 
— Chicago Police (@Chicago_Police) January 5, 2017 
Twitchy will update this story as details become available. Trending
